docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department announced on Monday that it would not ask the full Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit to reconsider a three-judge panel’s ruling against the 2010 health care law.

headline.main: Full Appeals Court Won’t Be Asked to Rule on Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Full Appeals Court Won’t Be Asked To Rule on Health Care Law

docs.snippet: The Justice Department announced on Monday that it would not ask the full Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit to reconsider a three-judge panel’s ruling against the 2010 health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Political independents, who account for more than one-quarter of the U.S. electorate and are key to the 2012 presidential election, have strong reservations about Barack Obama and the Republican brand.

headline.main: No One Is Winning Over a Volatile Electorate
headline.print_headline: No One Is Winning Over a Volatile Electorate

docs.snippet: Political independents, who account for more than one-quarter of the U.S. electorate and are key to the 2012 presidential election, have strong reservations about Barack Obama and the Republican brand.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG NEWS

docs.lead_paragraph: Under fire by some conservatives for his views on immigration, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Monday sought to return the spotlight to Mitt Romney and health care.

headline.main: Perry Presses Romney on Book Changes

docs.abstract: In a new video, Rick Perry's campaign highlights the fact that Mitt Romney boasted about the health care plan in Massachusetts in the original version of his book, "No Apology."
docs.snippet: In a new video, Rick Perry's campaign highlights the fact that Mitt Romney boasted about the health care plan in Massachusetts in the original version of his book, "No Apology."

headline.main: At Fund-Raisers, Obama Refers to Audiences at G.O.P. Debates

docs.abstract: In a series of West Coast fund-raising events on Sunday, President Obama criticized views held by the Republican Party's conservative base, and stressed that the coming election would be "a contest of values."
docs.snippet: In a series of West Coast fund-raising events on Sunday, President Obama criticized views held by the Republican Party's conservative base, and stressed that the coming election would be "a contest of values."
